alert.note: Alert for Kaiser to Rodgers Ridge; Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite NP outside of the valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued October 30 at 9:27PM PDT until November 02 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...First Significant Storm of the Wet Season Early This Week... A strong storm system will move out of the Gulf of Alaska on Monday and move into the Pacific Northwest on Monday night. We are expecting a strong cold front to move across the region on Tuesday night. Snow is expected to increase during the day on Tuesday with the potential heavy snow on Tuesday night. The front will push south into the Kern county area on Wednesday and provide lighter amounts. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible with isolated amounts up to 12 inches above 6000 feet. Total snow accumulations 3 to 6 inches from 5000 feet to 6000 feet. West winds could gust as high as 40 mph above 6000 feet. * WHERE...Yosemite NP outside of the valley, Upper San Joaquin River and Kaiser to Rodgers Ridge. * WHEN...From early Tuesday Morning through late Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult with high country road closures. The hazardous conditions could impact hikers and campers in the National Parks.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. A Winter Storm Watch means there is a potential for significant snow, sleet, or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.

area.areaDesc: Kaiser to Rodgers Ridge; Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite NP outside of the valley
